Methodologies

<a href="node.js-versus-next.js-a-react-approach.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-14lw9ot r-156hn8l r-rs99b7 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-15ysp7h r-ymttw5 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

Node.js versus Next.js - A React Approach

Interview

<a href="https://bryan-guner.gitbook.io/my-docs/v/mynotes/interview/question-set-1" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-42olwf r-rs99b7 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-15ysp7h r-ymttw5 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

Question Set #1:

<a href="https://www.gitbook.com/?utm_source=content&amp;utm_medium=trademark&amp;utm_campaign=-MWyt4j29ReMyImgcaO7" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1uwl36a r-z2wwpe r-1rasi3h r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-1fdo3w0 r-1mnahxq r-ymttw5 r-5njf8e r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-eu3ka r-1aockid" /></a>

Powered By <span class="css-901oao css-16my406 r-b88u0q">GitBook</span>

Node.js versus Next.js - A React Approach

<span key="dab35edee33d406abd7f8c959201d429"><span offset-key="dab35edee33d406abd7f8c959201d429:0">Back in the early days when websites were becoming interactive, JavaScript was introduced. The JS interpreter was present in the browser and did an amazing job of making websites interactive. All the computations were done on the local machine using in the in-built JS Engine. The makers of JS took JS which is confined to the browser and made it available to the local machine. With this change, a lot of new features were unlocked.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="f1aa3c0c35ac41ff986b1bad9335c13c"><span offset-key="f1aa3c0c35ac41ff986b1bad9335c13c:0">Access Local files</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="3f4c8405375f4a878e60426651f9ebcb"><span offset-key="3f4c8405375f4a878e60426651f9ebcb:0">Monitor Networks</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="fac8990b0489481eb3e75dec965a9db6"><span offset-key="fac8990b0489481eb3e75dec965a9db6:0">Listen to HTTP requests</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="839fa2a926c64c6eb5df60213c1ad2d6"><span offset-key="839fa2a926c64c6eb5df60213c1ad2d6:0">Access Database directly</span></span>

<span key="f0158d356e7b4db992aeba8c8098e66a"><span offset-key="f0158d356e7b4db992aeba8c8098e66a:0">There are two types of applications built with Node.js. The first one are utility applications which are used to enhance the performance of the main application. For example, hot-reload functionality is a utility function. While coding, the changes are made as we code along. The second type of applications built with Node.js are web servers that handle requests from other sites to provide software services.</span></span>

### 

<span key="dd1c0fea3d8b4103b6ac1b28fc4ef46e"><span offset-key="dd1c0fea3d8b4103b6ac1b28fc4ef46e:0">Next.js</span></span>

<span key="f1c9e6daa6604b02bbc839196afcd691"><span offset-key="f1c9e6daa6604b02bbc839196afcd691:0">The official website talks about why Next.js was introduced. Let us discuss the reasons in detail to get a perspective about Next.js.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4139ef0e7a3c4137901ce381264193d6"><span offset-key="4139ef0e7a3c4137901ce381264193d6:0">In his </span></span><a href="https://rauchg.com/2014/7-principles-of-rich-web-applications" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2fccc9abffa14804872f316020ea1384" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-27048_259-27049-237__"><span data-key="b81538675e99493691ed55e9843feb9d"><span data-offset-key="b81538675e99493691ed55e9843feb9d:0">blog</span></span></span></a><span key="0105f763888744329ed6ccacb2ecf9ab"><span offset-key="0105f763888744329ed6ccacb2ecf9ab:0">, Guillermo Rauch talks about the seven principles for creating rich web applications. In short, they are</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="7d566bfb66c248f38d0749e082ace23e"><span offset-key="7d566bfb66c248f38d0749e082ace23e:0">Pre-rendering pages for optimal performance</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="2448c6abbfcb433f86bfbf73ea25b922"><span offset-key="2448c6abbfcb433f86bfbf73ea25b922:0">User-Input must be dealt with immediately: For example, when we type into the Google search box, results are displayed instantly without any reloading. AJAX, which stands Asynchronous JavaScript And XML, is an example of this.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="bcb94ec45d7a492bb6ed9827e0757ee2"><span offset-key="bcb94ec45d7a492bb6ed9827e0757ee2:0">Let the user know about changes in data on the server without asking. This ensures minimal reloading and maximum data throughout the screen.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="0dfa34678afe487ea36b4ee1a4a2a205"><span offset-key="0dfa34678afe487ea36b4ee1a4a2a205:0">Ensuring proper data exchange with the server: Libraries like Axios, Node-fetch, etc. have enhanced the level of control we have over network calls. Therefore, taking full advantage of the network calls to maximize user experience is necessary. Error handling, data synchronization, and offline caches are essential for optimal levels of data exchange with the server irrespective of network conditions.</span></span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">5.</span>
    <span key="742953e1f3324c539d9ecd5f68e7eb0d"><span offset-key="742953e1f3324c539d9ecd5f68e7eb0d:0">Consider the problem of infinite pagination. Since web browsers don’t store history, the problem of navigation is a significant one. User’s don’t expect changes when visiting the previous pages. Therefore maintaining custom local caches is essential for fast feedback.</span></span>

6.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">6.</span>
    <span key="20a88fedac0d4bb2bc1091ef87bdb8f5"><span offset-key="20a88fedac0d4bb2bc1091ef87bdb8f5:0">Push code updates: Data handling and API calls must be handled carefully. Changes in data should correspond to changes in code as well. This is predominantly done to avoid errors during data fetch.</span></span>

7.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">7.</span>
    <span key="edae2304d8a3482cab8b752169559b31"><span offset-key="edae2304d8a3482cab8b752169559b31:0">Predict user’s behavior: Understand patterns and have mechanisms for predicting the final user input.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="5ffef4badac84edb8bb6d0f6e816beeb"><span offset-key="5ffef4badac84edb8bb6d0f6e816beeb:0">Building a PHP like system with the convenience and vast resources of Node.js.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="eada2e3063d64994aa2a86080dea93d2"><span offset-key="eada2e3063d64994aa2a86080dea93d2:0">Enabling easy-to-setup server-side rendering for React. Node.js does offer support for server-side rendering, but the setup is tedious and involves a steep learning curve.</span></span>

### 

<span key="ab6fc5ff9f1d4c94abeeac5b426e7b0b"><span offset-key="ab6fc5ff9f1d4c94abeeac5b426e7b0b:0">Server Side Rendering vs. Client-Side Rendering</span></span>

<span key="8fa542a27e424ec980692c21a2e80b1c"><span offset-key="8fa542a27e424ec980692c21a2e80b1c:0">Walmart Labs has written a well detailed </span></span><a href="https://medium.com/walmartglobaltech/the-benefits-of-server-side-rendering-over-client-side-rendering-5d07ff2cefe8" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9bd8f22251954c1880d1ae101abd6594" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-27048_259-27049-237__"><span data-key="8f6846e9adc0419eb1585f6d69a8dce9"><span data-offset-key="8f6846e9adc0419eb1585f6d69a8dce9:0">blog</span></span></span></a><span key="2b5f81b3b3b4406fa2cba552c9750e64"><span offset-key="2b5f81b3b3b4406fa2cba552c9750e64:0"> on the subject of performance enhancement using server-side rendering. Make sure to check that out. It details the performance enhancement that Next.js enables concerning the create-react-app package.</span></span>

<span key="a52f021b24e349d59ca10bcc28f0c816"><span offset-key="a52f021b24e349d59ca10bcc28f0c816:0">The two diagrams mentioned below detail the processes involved in server-side rendering and client-side rendering. We observe that server-side rendered applications are one step ahead of client-side rendered applications. They display the HTML and then load the JS files, therefore enhancing the user experience in terms of performance and loading time. It also falls in line with the 7 principles listed above.</span></span>

<span key="a60785d24e5a496392ea7a2df1e32b77"><span offset-key="a60785d24e5a496392ea7a2df1e32b77:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.section.io/engineering-education/node-versus-next-react-approach/medium.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="abb8d2462fbd45278f2a9ee7a9d93caf" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-27048_259-27049-237__"><span data-key="96186486f8da48e9bcc7e24bf86e8dd8"><span data-offset-key="96186486f8da48e9bcc7e24bf86e8dd8:0">Image Source</span></span></span></a><span key="d6eb677e318f48778a51cbfa5146b5f0"><span offset-key="d6eb677e318f48778a51cbfa5146b5f0:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="9fe149ff64c24d1583e5ae86c643c8e4"><span offset-key="9fe149ff64c24d1583e5ae86c643c8e4:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.section.io/engineering-education/node-versus-next-react-approach/medium.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="83497fe73523488d89b54cf7229dea67" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-27048_259-27049-237__"><span data-key="df06a70f7bb640599710b8406e062a3c"><span data-offset-key="df06a70f7bb640599710b8406e062a3c:0">Image Source</span></span></span></a><span key="7b4fab99d1af43faa728e3144c729d91"><span offset-key="7b4fab99d1af43faa728e3144c729d91:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="5caa4c56e52a46578984a40546a6a594"><span offset-key="5caa4c56e52a46578984a40546a6a594:0">We have looked at building React applications using create-react-app in a previous two article series. You can review them </span></span><a href="https://www.section.io/build-an-outlook-clone-using-react/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a72c594cc8734e44b9101266ad7e3f6b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-27048_259-27049-237__"><span data-key="896677b2912f4be493c4f79ddea1ebc0"><span data-offset-key="896677b2912f4be493c4f79ddea1ebc0:0">here</span></span></span></a><span key="8b52ea2ac82f4a32bc0bcbe22019b376"><span offset-key="8b52ea2ac82f4a32bc0bcbe22019b376:0"> and </span></span><a href="https://www.section.io/build-an-outlook-clone-using-react-hooks/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6a395b8fef9e4485b14a7c796bf036dc" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-27048_259-27049-237__"><span data-key="a9a09cc10a51496bb23ecd573c0dc911"><span data-offset-key="a9a09cc10a51496bb23ecd573c0dc911:0">here</span></span></span></a><span key="9a554626bb8e4551a78bf9cf11b72c53"><span offset-key="9a554626bb8e4551a78bf9cf11b72c53:0">.</span></span>

<span key="36a637b553e24bb9b04575f7cd4511cd"><span offset-key="36a637b553e24bb9b04575f7cd4511cd:0">We will be using </span>`create-next-app`<span offset-key="36a637b553e24bb9b04575f7cd4511cd:2"> instead of </span>`create-react-app`<span offset-key="36a637b553e24bb9b04575f7cd4511cd:4"> for building next.js applications. Next.js </span></span><a href="https://nextjs.org/learn/basics/create-nextjs-app" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3ac735e0084f46608577128b38c99e04" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-27048_259-27049-237__"><span data-key="595c2d593fa34f459ec3bf15bac10a55"><span data-offset-key="595c2d593fa34f459ec3bf15bac10a55:0">documentation</span></span></span></a><span key="0723d9ced03b49f2ae5bae9fbd14b3c1"><span offset-key="0723d9ced03b49f2ae5bae9fbd14b3c1:0"> provides a detailed step-by-step tutorial on how to implement a Next.js project. We will focus on the major differences between the two and understand the features in depth.</span></span>

<span key="0d021176f4614a309301793b5bd130da"><span offset-key="0d021176f4614a309301793b5bd130da:0">Node.js provides a very vast framework and includes many libraries to support every need a developer might come across. Next.js enhances the user experience by introducing server-side rendering with a lower threshold for developers. Using the existing React knowledge, developers can build SSR applications.</span></span>

### 

<span key="21ecf94bf27e472ca9a5cac1c03e646c"><span offset-key="21ecf94bf27e472ca9a5cac1c03e646c:0">Node.js vs. Next.js</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="6360501ef7ff4d28b1bd5be868fc05b8"><span offset-key="6360501ef7ff4d28b1bd5be868fc05b8:0">We use </span>`create-react-app`<span offset-key="6360501ef7ff4d28b1bd5be868fc05b8:2"> for building React applications with Node.js. On the contrary, </span>`create-next-app`<span offset-key="6360501ef7ff4d28b1bd5be868fc05b8:4">(CNA) is used for building applications with Next.js.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="3a30e410497245a9a8abe6c0f5a90f4a"><span offset-key="3a30e410497245a9a8abe6c0f5a90f4a:0">Discussing the differences between the frameworks should begin with the directory structures. </span>`create-react-app`<span offset-key="3a30e410497245a9a8abe6c0f5a90f4a:2">(CRA) generates the following directory structure.</span></span>

1

<span key="8e5532e506b94aa696d9be22b46ad241"><span offset-key="8e5532e506b94aa696d9be22b46ad241:0">nodesampleproject</span></span>

2

<span key="a6f62e0a229247f2addc75f9e028922d"><span offset-key="a6f62e0a229247f2addc75f9e028922d:0">├── README.md</span></span>

3

<span key="05998da381be4d9ca2def775125ba06f"><span offset-key="05998da381be4d9ca2def775125ba06f:0">├── node\_modules</span></span>

4

<span key="2c3392ff4ca344f3ad7f6baeaf6bca25"><span offset-key="2c3392ff4ca344f3ad7f6baeaf6bca25:0">├── package.json</span></span>

5

<span key="0770d68d88134fdc84a16574cb3aed01"><span offset-key="0770d68d88134fdc84a16574cb3aed01:0">├── .gitignore</span></span>

6

<span key="1f8f0d6920f44ec6859dccefa1f7fb04"><span offset-key="1f8f0d6920f44ec6859dccefa1f7fb04:0">├── public</span></span>

7

<span key="d26624a07964453b9223c96b821a71a4"><span offset-key="d26624a07964453b9223c96b821a71a4:0">│ ├── favicon.ico</span></span>

8

<span key="24535c49de854c11a975c2015d883a4b"><span offset-key="24535c49de854c11a975c2015d883a4b:0">│ ├── index.html</span></span>

9

<span key="8595880b923e4ad9b98a09e3007bdf02"><span offset-key="8595880b923e4ad9b98a09e3007bdf02:0">│ ├── logo192.png</span></span>

10

<span key="727dac912e90478fb36d809847388933"><span offset-key="727dac912e90478fb36d809847388933:0">│ ├── logo512.png</span></span>

11

<span key="61b1337ad8854da791e6285e00986254"><span offset-key="61b1337ad8854da791e6285e00986254:0">│ ├── manifest.json</span></span>

12

<span key="dbb650b17c13495ea7f74b1f90edd5ef"><span offset-key="dbb650b17c13495ea7f74b1f90edd5ef:0">│ └── robots.txt</span></span>

13

<span key="005b4e8851fd44c8b715c68d697e5433"><span offset-key="005b4e8851fd44c8b715c68d697e5433:0">└── src</span></span>

14

<span key="3920d084515a4ec5a1e45eda234d42f4"><span offset-key="3920d084515a4ec5a1e45eda234d42f4:0"> ├── App.css</span></span>

15

<span key="09aea49fac654d21b4c1bb5774cfdff4"><span offset-key="09aea49fac654d21b4c1bb5774cfdff4:0"> ├── App.js</span></span>

16

<span key="d3c5c82de0b140819ddf5de1a55da591"><span offset-key="d3c5c82de0b140819ddf5de1a55da591:0"> ├── App.test.js</span></span>

17

<span key="39764d2963964a5284ef5705e127f1f4"><span offset-key="39764d2963964a5284ef5705e127f1f4:0"> ├── index.css</span></span>

18

<span key="27a4ae4057ae4d6595ceccbcfe06032a"><span offset-key="27a4ae4057ae4d6595ceccbcfe06032a:0"> ├── index.js</span></span>

19

<span key="812d2c48dbe046d3a67d141a039c40d5"><span offset-key="812d2c48dbe046d3a67d141a039c40d5:0"> ├── logo.svg</span></span>

20

<span key="2396ee7e61f24eb79e9c3d49dcad4a07"><span offset-key="2396ee7e61f24eb79e9c3d49dcad4a07:0"> └── serviceWorker.js</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="7371f3a287674b148b62f82ba70d881e"><span offset-key="7371f3a287674b148b62f82ba70d881e:0">whereas, </span>`create-next-app`<span offset-key="7371f3a287674b148b62f82ba70d881e:2"> generates the directory structure below:</span></span>

1

<span key="3e1b10a86080445082f92cc007a2677e"><span offset-key="3e1b10a86080445082f92cc007a2677e:0">nextsampleproject</span></span>

2

<span key="18174aae26e94ea1b420e642685d9ce0"><span offset-key="18174aae26e94ea1b420e642685d9ce0:0">├── README.md</span></span>

3

<span key="3b97c935012b4eceb61f9f5f3602531d"><span offset-key="3b97c935012b4eceb61f9f5f3602531d:0">├── .next</span></span>

4

<span key="7a5e95e49aba477eb7b568e00081680b"><span offset-key="7a5e95e49aba477eb7b568e00081680b:0">├── node\_modules</span></span>

5

<span key="241fba3b133a4c27bced924ff14a0745"><span offset-key="241fba3b133a4c27bced924ff14a0745:0">├── package.json</span></span>

6

<span key="8e9432f9c31942228025be4de12b8f70"><span offset-key="8e9432f9c31942228025be4de12b8f70:0">├── .gitignore</span></span>

7

<span key="dd874573808c4080a2dd01f9861205db"><span offset-key="dd874573808c4080a2dd01f9861205db:0">├── styles</span></span>

8

<span key="1e41b974a79c427bb05d218dec256802"><span offset-key="1e41b974a79c427bb05d218dec256802:0">│ ├── globals.css</span></span>

9

<span key="9663d5f5cf864c8888b948b75eb06870"><span offset-key="9663d5f5cf864c8888b948b75eb06870:0">│ ├── Home.module.css</span></span>

10

<span key="967fcad795284461b9db1bdf9d36f48d"><span offset-key="967fcad795284461b9db1bdf9d36f48d:0">├── public</span></span>

11

<span key="b76db67d398545f9bb60277a1d404df5"><span offset-key="b76db67d398545f9bb60277a1d404df5:0">│ ├── favicon.ico</span></span>

12

<span key="3dd626497e124d6b9ccc7f5c25ca1eb4"><span offset-key="3dd626497e124d6b9ccc7f5c25ca1eb4:0">│ ├── vercel.svg</span></span>

13

<span key="febc45cb564140e585e589eb604b932f"><span offset-key="febc45cb564140e585e589eb604b932f:0">└── pages</span></span>

14

<span key="571990f279224ee49b0b8bdab9bb2c73"><span offset-key="571990f279224ee49b0b8bdab9bb2c73:0"> ├── api</span></span>

15

<span key="d980a0bc712d441d9e9b4c0fb7884ac0"><span offset-key="d980a0bc712d441d9e9b4c0fb7884ac0:0"> ├── hello.js</span></span>

16

<span key="2753eb0d82b648fdbc902d02095fe48e"><span offset-key="2753eb0d82b648fdbc902d02095fe48e:0"> ├── \_app.js\_</span></span>

17

<span key="ac922c0360ed4f1c913f562c27d98c56"><span offset-key="ac922c0360ed4f1c913f562c27d98c56:0"> ├── index.js</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="befe39f570ab4133908d5d54eaefead0"><span offset-key="befe39f570ab4133908d5d54eaefead0:0">The App component in CRA is the main file called </span>*Index.js*<span offset-key="befe39f570ab4133908d5d54eaefead0:2">. </span>*App.js*<span offset-key="befe39f570ab4133908d5d54eaefead0:4"> is the parent component that calls all the child components. On the contrary, in </span>*Next.js*<span offset-key="befe39f570ab4133908d5d54eaefead0:6">, the </span>*\_app.js*<span offset-key="befe39f570ab4133908d5d54eaefead0:8"> file enables loading initial props using getInitialProps function. This function offers server-side rendering by preloading the webpage with the initial props.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="cdeb9872f9cc4324b5d4f799c661feed"><span offset-key="cdeb9872f9cc4324b5d4f799c661feed:0">In </span>`create-react-app`<span offset-key="cdeb9872f9cc4324b5d4f799c661feed:2">, we need to run </span>`npm run build`<span offset-key="cdeb9872f9cc4324b5d4f799c661feed:4"> to make the code production-ready. Next.js offers many functionalities including webpack compiling and code splitting. We can specify our webpack and the babel configs in package.json as well.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="d976c48d437b46578bea2d6abe7571d0"><span offset-key="d976c48d437b46578bea2d6abe7571d0:0">Next.js offers </span>`react-fast-refresh`<span offset-key="d976c48d437b46578bea2d6abe7571d0:2">, which is an enhanced version of React Hot Reloading provided by CRA. It makes the react app reloads very smooth and fast with changes in code. A react-native concept has been included in the Next.js framework.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="06c3550e036645c1991a1ff32eebad00"><span offset-key="06c3550e036645c1991a1ff32eebad00:0">Next.js offers static file serving. This way all resources like images, CSS files, robots.txt, and global js files can be placed in the public folder, and such resources can be easily called using relative paths. </span>`create-react-app`<span offset-key="06c3550e036645c1991a1ff32eebad00:2"> does allow static file serving. When it comes to JS files they need to be structured as an external library. Furthermore, they are stored in a global variable referenced within the code.</span></span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">5.</span>
    <span key="25af5866a10f4f468655fb6e23966cca"><span offset-key="25af5866a10f4f468655fb6e23966cca:0">Next.js is ready for production from the start of the project. Using </span>`create-react-app`<span offset-key="25af5866a10f4f468655fb6e23966cca:2">, the deployment process is lengthy. Depending on the type of website, the deployment techniques differ. These can be found in the </span></span><a href="https://create-react-app.dev/docs/deployment/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c293349ef31b43ec9f01feb1bfea1361" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-27048_259-27049-237__"><span data-key="01460abc03d74668a57ae9546a587687"><span data-offset-key="01460abc03d74668a57ae9546a587687:0">documentation</span></span></span></a><span key="7a3ab997bc8140a1bd5efba9fa0b08cd"><span offset-key="7a3ab997bc8140a1bd5efba9fa0b08cd:0"> for </span>`create-react-app`</span>

6.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">6.</span>
    <span key="0841459f2ce4442f82dfc2e48efd59c2"><span offset-key="0841459f2ce4442f82dfc2e48efd59c2:0">HTML files received when loading an application built using Next.js are shown in the figure below. The website you are viewing this blog on, is client-side rendered. Let’s do something fun. Press </span>**Cltrl+Shift+I**<span offset-key="0841459f2ce4442f82dfc2e48efd59c2:2"> to access the developer tools and click on the </span>**elements**<span offset-key="0841459f2ce4442f82dfc2e48efd59c2:4"> option. You will find a </span>*short piece of HTML*<span offset-key="0841459f2ce4442f82dfc2e48efd59c2:6"> calling JS files as and when user inputs are received. Review the differences between the HTML file that you observe in the console and the image shown below.</span></span>

<span key="b60f63f3b85d45a4b84aca7d3ca70bf6"><span offset-key="b60f63f3b85d45a4b84aca7d3ca70bf6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="aabab1526839454db16ea40e091012b9"></span>

<span key="1c2f5f0ae6c744d6847c8f88553af90c"><span offset-key="1c2f5f0ae6c744d6847c8f88553af90c:0"> </span>*Screenshot of the HTML rendered on Server-Side.*</span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="73a3f0c5ad144d798a8f0f2e97116865"><span offset-key="73a3f0c5ad144d798a8f0f2e97116865:0">SSR enables enhanced Search-Engine-Optimization. SEO is easily performed using Next because search engines have more data to parse through. This helps websites stand out within search engines.</span></span>

### 

<span key="ea46d13bf5414aed83e3a1b88260830f"><span offset-key="ea46d13bf5414aed83e3a1b88260830f:0">Conclusion</span></span>

<span key="6c17beded1374bc9b6edad597b4e2d51"><span offset-key="6c17beded1374bc9b6edad597b4e2d51:0">We have gone through a huge list of differences between Next.js and create-react-app. Although Next.js beats create-react-app applications in most of the cases, create-react-app is the most suitable in cases of CSR Applications. CSR applications might be a necessity when SSR is not an option, for example, when videos are played. Companies like Netflix take advantages of both worlds and designed superior systems. We hope you keep in mind the differences and points mentioned above while designing your applications. Be legendary.</span></span>

<a href="../my_docs/composition-vs-inheritance.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-14lw9ot r-190qawg r-z2wwpe r-rs99b7 r-4dj0k7 r-1loqt21 r-1quu1zo r-1ro0kt6 r-18u37iz r-16y2uox r-1wbh5a2 r-nsbfu8 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1rasi3h r-1472mwg r-1vzi8xi r-lrsllp" />
